alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 3:41PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 415 PM MDT... At 341 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cheyenne Wells, moving northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 147 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
